intro: Chiococca racemosa var. yucatana, commonly known as the Yucatan chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
